body.name: Perixx PERIBOARD-317 Wired Backlit USB Keyboard, Big Print Letter with White Illuminated LED, US English Layout,Black
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Perixx USA and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Sunday, February 18 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 17 hrs 45 mins
FREE delivery Sunday, February 18 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 9 hrs 30 mins
features: White LED backlight: bright and evenly distributed backlit keys, easy typing in lower light environment. Ideal for studio work, office. The backlit can be turned on and off.
Stylish chiclet-key design: the lighted chiclet design provide spacing between the keys to avoid pressing on the wrong keys; large printed letter on the keys for more visibility while typing

Sleek profile: Low profile keys with larger key surface for responsive, more silent and accurate typing. High quality ABS print prevents keycap color abrasion. The durable membrane key switch provides 5 million times key press life cycle.
Plug-and-play feature: with wired USB interface, quick and Easy installation. 1. 6M long cable, flexible for different home/office setup. Slim keyboard Dimension: 440x129x27mm
Compatible with Windows 98SE/2000/ME/XP/Vista/7/8/10/11. Package includes: 1 x periboard-317 US. 12-Month limited
Please note that when the backlit function is on, the scroll lock feature will be off. When the backlit function is off, the scroll lock feature will be on.
body.description: Periboard-317 is a wired illuminated full size keyboard. One-piece design, cost effective, sturdy and durable for different usages.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.4 4.4 out of 5 stars 7,887 ratings 4.4 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: backlight works well, easy to change between the three-color modes with one button. Buttons are large and easy to depress. They are marked with large print letters to be easily seen. Came well packaged in a heavy-duty box and form to fit packing. Easy plug and play installation with one USB connection. Three colors: Red, Blue and a shade of purple. OH and no backlight as well. Overall, good product and I recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Was skeptical that a keyboard this cheap could be such good quality. Quiet keys, large print font on buttons, and backlight. Don’t spend more on the same keyboard! Very happy with this

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good value for the money
reviews.reviewText: I have not yet run into the issues others seem to have run into - yet!Just got the product yesterday and so far, so good. I do appreciate the LARGE printing on the keys and the gray-dimed white light. I have not found the keys 'sharp' at the edges nor the typing experince unbearable.Touch typing is not a chore and keys are not overly loud. I recommend this product for those looking to have a baclit wired keyboard. It does not have 'legs' to pull out so to type on an angle - it is a low profile.I suppose you could put it on something to make it more ergonomic. I do recommend it as of today.Hopefully I can avoid the many issues others have faced- we'll see !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works Better Than Expected
reviews.reviewText: Easy to see no matter the lighting around you. Keys are spaced nicely, and the typeface for the letters is very clear. Great keyboard.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great keyboard with perfect lighting
reviews.reviewText: The lighting is perfect at night--you can comfortably type with no other light source. And you can very easily turn the lights on or off by hitting the ScrLk key (which has a pic of a sun on it, but I also stuck a tiny sticker next to it). I bought 2 of these for 2 computers a year and a half ago and both still work great. Love 'em.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Grat keyboard for a little money
reviews.reviewText: Most backlit keyboards aren't sarisfctoeybon one or more levels...their lighting is subpar; their typing experience is poor; and cheap wireless keyboard/mouse combos aren't encrypted.Then there the Perrix wired USB keyboard, with its big, bright backlighting. The keys have a satisfying punch to them, the lights are easy to turn on and off with the Scroll Lock key. The size is right, with full sized keys but less bezel and key gap.There is another version similar in size to this one, but with smaller multi-function F keys and media control; omitting all that lets the F keys stay the same size as the rest.I would recommend this keyboard for the quality and feel, but at this price it's a shoo+in.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Cheap and ugly, but gets the job done I guess
reviews.reviewText: This may sound like a negative review, and it kinda is, but let me put this in perspective: I used one of these keyboards for two years straight, and when I finally spilled soda on it and accidentally destroyed it, I bought another one just like it. To put it another way, I definitely recommend this keyboard if you're on a tight budget like I am.Just make sure you're aware of what you're getting. This thing works perfectly fine, and it lights up so you can see it in the dark. But that's really where the pros end and the cons begin.And the cons are these: This thing is horribly ugly. I know that seems like a picky criticism, but when you have to spend many hours every day intimately with it, the ugliness can really start to get to you. It has a really shoddy paint job which is just an absolute eyesore.Also, the paint WILL come off, after regular use. It's not a nightmare like some cheap keyboards I've seen, but it's definitely noticeable. You should still be able to read the keys though.Finally, this thing is WAY too bright. As you can see in the pictures, it's not just the text that lights up but the sides of the keys as well.All that being said, I did own one of these for two years and used it every day. The keys feel fine---nothing great but not bad either. I'm a fairly fast typist too, so no worries there.If you can afford one of those costly Logitech illuminated keyboards which are non-painted, then I highly recommend you get one of those instead. But boy are they costly! So, again, if you're on a tight budget like I am but still need something that lights up, this will do in a pinch.

reviews.reviewerName: Really like the keyboard. It’s what I wanted keys that light up. Installation was easy just plug and play. Perfect deal.
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lighted keys work great.
reviews.reviewText: I really like the lighted keys. It’s what I wanted. Shipped fast and easy to install.

Luce genial, se siente genial, las teclas son suaves y silenciosas. Aunque la costruccion se siente un poco barata, pero por el precio es un buen trato.Un problema menor es que las luces son un poco mas brillantes de lo que aparentan en el material promocional. Desearia que fueran mas tenues, pero esa es una preferencia personal.La forma redonda de las teclas hace un poco mas facil el pulsar por error teclas aledañas, pero es algo a lo que toma tiempo acostumbrarse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: voor mensen met slecht zicht perfect
reviews.reviewText: Voor seniore dame, kan nu de toetsen weer zien: dubbele werking backlight en grotere opdruk op de toetsen werkt wonderen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Teclado muy legible, ligero y compacto. Versión USA sobrecargada de precio.
reviews.reviewText: El teclado es muy compacto y ligero. Las teclas muy suaves y cómodas.Es un teclado "full size", o sea, tiene las teclas «Windows» y «Menú» a la derecha además de la tecla «Windows» izquierda.Esto es práctico si lo usas con el entorno de escritorio KDE Plasma de Linux, pues esas teclas pueden ser asignadas para la función «compose» sin perder la funcionalidad de menú inicio con la tecla «Win» izquierda.Lo más destacable del teclado, por supuesto, es la retro-iluminación de las teclas.Tiene un solo color e intensidad. La iluminación no resulta en absoluto molesta, incluso en plena obscuridad.Se puede apagar con la tecla Scroll Lock que además sigue reteniendo su funcionalidad normal.El diseño de botones tipo «chiclet» de plástico duro facilita la limpieza del polvo.Una vez uno se acostumbra, resulta irresistible teclear y escribir. ¡Una maravilla!Hasta aquí todo bien. Sin embargo lo que resulta incomprensible es la política de precios de Amazon.Yo he comprado la versión ANSI (con layout US English). Amazon lo vende por 43,74 euros. El mismo teclado en versiones alemana, española, etc. lo vende por 25 euros.¡¡¡ Un 75 % mas caro!!!¿Por qué?Los teclados están fabricados en China, tanto las versiones «europeas» como las americanas. La empresa diseñadora y comercializadora, —Perixx— es alemana y los teclados se envían DESDE ALEMANIA.¿A qué se debe ese sobre-precio exagerado? ¿Un arancel cultural? ¿ ! ? ...Lo más increíble es que la tienda online de Perixx vende la versión española por 25 euros, la versión americana por 24 euros y la versión alemana por 23 euros.En este caso se entienden las diferencias de precio por cuestiones de logística y economía de escala, pero por favor Amazon, ¡un 75 % más cara la versión USA!¿Por qué?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 29, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Choice of backlit colours. Nice, soft-touch keys. Excellent illumination in low light.

After one month.Bought this as I have glaucoma and bad eyesight. The backlight is good when you look straight down at the keyboard. However, in typing position (typically 45 degrees for me) the lighting is uneven. You can seen the four main LEDs below SHIFT, XC, BN, and / keys. Radiating in a circle from out there the light gradually fades.I am a transcriptionist so typing response is my biggest priority:Typing response: 4+/5Large Print: Awesome 5/5Latency: NegligibleBacklighting: 2/5Gaming: 4/5 (FEAR series, Bioshock series, Assassin's Creed, Dead Space series, and more)Note: Not a mechanical keyboard so if you cannot soft-type without banging keys this might not have a long life. Treat it like a delicate laptop keyboard and you will be fine. I can type with zero typing sound so no problem.
